p: Compound 8 has a pseudomolecular ion of m/ z 315.0720, indicative of the molecular formula C 13H 16O 9. It was identified as dihydroxybenzoic acid O-hexoside based on fragment ion at m/ z 153 for [M-H-162] −, due to the loss of a hexoxyl moiety, and fragment ion at m/ z 109 for [M-H-162-44] − indicating a further loss of CO 2 moiety, in agreement with Karar and Kuhnert [ 29]. Meanwhile, compound 14, which exhibited a pseudomolecular ion of m/ z 329.0878 and base peak at m/ z 167 for [M-H-162] − for a neural loss of a hexoxyl moiety, was assigned as vanillic acid- O-hexoside. The assignment was supported by comparison with the fragmentation pattern previously reported by Morales-Soto et al. [ 30].
